intro: Heteropterys anoptera, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its large, velvety leaves that are typically dark green on top and lighter in color underneath. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release numerous small, wind-dispersed seeds. Heteropterys anoptera is native to Central and South America and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and clearings.
